message: django-pure-pagination is implemented to accept already existing code using Django's pagination module. Thought it would be useful for developers that want to upgrade existing projects easily and without having to learn a different api.
I'm pretty new to open-sourcing code, this is my second attempt at publishing a django-app.
@bat thanks... how silly of me forgetting the link!!! :)
you need to answer the question "why would I use this over core pagination?" at the very beginning of your readme.  "advanced pagination features" doesn't say enough
@ptone that makes a lot of sense. Thanks for your help, I'll try updating the documentation tomorrow.
And so community development begins. "Your community is the people wh come to your events" -- Enrique Bastos

have you ever tried django-pagination app? I have been using it for a long time. It's easier to use and yet so powerful. Can't see any better feature in that app. Is there some hidden feature we should notice?
nice @jamespaxi ! how optimus is paginating for example: 200.000 rows? I had problems paginating that number of rows with django-pagination @javinievas
thanks @panchicore! mmmh I think the only real bottleneck would be the database, you could try what it might look like using the example project with "how many names = 200000".
@panchicore did you have the same problems using django's paginator? django-pure-paginator core is the same as django's one, so performance should be the same
@jamespaxi you should steal some of my concepts from django-paging (like EndlessPaginator)
